image.altText: Tammy Tyrrell and Jacqui Lambie

props.synopsis: Tasmanian senator Tammy Tyrrell will sit on the crossbench as an independent after announcing she is resigning from the Jacqui Lambie Network.

title.children: Tasmanian senator Tammy Tyrrell resigns from Jacqui Lambie Network

image.altText: Two Melbourne United basketballers embrace mid-court after winning a game in the NBL finals series.

props.synopsis: Tasmania Jackjumpers will have to go to Melbourne for the NBL championship decider after Melbourne United stop them clinching a first title with a win in Hobart.

title.children: Melbourne United spoil Jackjumpers' party with game-four win in Hobart

image.altText: Roe Creek near Alice Springs

props.synopsis: Southern Australia can expect ideal weather over the Easter break until at least Monday, when rain that has been pummelling parts of the NT moves south.

title.children: Ideal Easter weather across southern Australia before outback soaking moves south

image.altText: A close up of a man holding a bright fruit cocoa pod pulls apart small pillowy seeds.

props.synopsis: Over the last few years, a peculiar change has taken place in Papua New Guinea's north-west, with remote, traditional villages modernising at a rapid pace. Here's how the price of cocoa is fuelling development.

title.children: Inside this brightly coloured pod is white slimy gold. Tiny PNG villages are cashing in

image.altText: A man in uniform carrying a large gun stands on a road at night, looking at the camera

props.synopsis: If last Friday night's deadly ambush at the Crocus City Hall near Moscow proved anything, it's that while Islamic State might be down, it's certainly not out.

title.children: 'Slaughtering civilians with gusto': How Islamic State was forced to change

image.altText: Woman wearing glasses in red top leans back in chair with laptop in lap and notebook in hand

props.synopsis: With a youth curfew now in place in Alice Springs, there are questions over what powers the police will have to keep kids off the streets overnight.

title.children: 'Not locking up kids': Authorities defend Alice Springs curfew amid concerns over police powers

image.altText: A composite image of a cargo ship crashing into a bridge, Princess Catherine and a performer dancing on stage.

props.synopsis: Are you across this week's news headlines? Put yourself to the test.

title.children: Weekly News Quiz: Baltimore's boat crash, Splendour cancelled and Kate's diagnosis

image.altText: Person (Jan Cameron) walking into the Hobart Magistrates Court with a smile.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's leading businesswomen, Jan Cameron, will be disqualified from managing corporations for five years after being sentenced for hiding a substantial shareholding in baby formula company Bellamy's Australia.

title.children: Kathmandu founder Jan Cameron sentenced for hiding $14m shareholding in baby formula company

image.altText: dog in tent with lady and son

props.synopsis: Learning basic pet first aid skills could help save your pet's life, especially if you are kilometres from the nearest vet.

title.children: Camping with your dog this Easter? These are the dangers lurking at campsites

image.altText: A concept design for an AFL stadium at Macquarie Point.

props.synopsis: Labor stalwarts and unions believe Tasmanian Labor needs to rethink its stance on the proposed Hobart AFL stadium following its election loss, with one commentator saying confusion over its policy contributed to defeat.

title.children: With 170,000 foundation members for Tasmania's AFL team, does Labor need to change its stadium position?

image.altText: A woman wearing a blue button up shirt holds a pile of books while standing in front of a house.

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian charity is preparing to freight a shipping container filled with 850 boxes of textbooks and library books to school students in need in the Pacific.

title.children: Donated Tasmanian schoolbooks travel by barge, carried by hand on jungle tracks to reach PNG children

image.altText: craig wright

props.synopsis: Bitcoin. Ask anyone to explain it and you'll either get a blank stare or a blustery, confident answer. But one Australian man claimed to know all — until it turned out he didn't.

title.children: The Australian liar who claimed to be the creator of bitcoin

image.altText: A young man with brown curly hair wearing a suit walks on the street.

props.synopsis: A New York judge sentences Sam Bankman-Fried for stealing $US8 billion from customers of the now-bankrupt FTX exchange he founded.

title.children: Sam Bankman-Fried sentenced to 25 years in jail over FTX fraud

image.altText: Wine harvest Australia good generic

props.synopsis: Wine producers welcome an end to Chinese tariffs, with some Australian wines expected to hit shelves in China within days.

title.children: 'It's a crisis': Australian winemakers hail axing of Chinese tariffs, but warn it's no quick fix

image.altText: Joey Manu

props.synopsis: Roosters coach Trent Robinson questions the bunker over an early no-try call, but says it wasn't the reason his side lost to Penrith.

title.children: Robinson says he won't blame bunker for Roosters loss despite crucial call

image.altText: Chocolate prices up for Easter

props.synopsis: Problems in Africa are leading to big increases in the prices of cocoa and chocolate — but consumers are still stocking up on eggs and bunnies for Easter.

title.children: Chocolate prices continue to rise ahead of Easter amid worldwide cocoa shortage

image.altText: Composite image of Port Hedland Councillor Adrian McRae and Russian President Vladimir Putin

props.synopsis: Former Port Hedland shire president Arnold Carter says newly elected councillor Adrian McRae's fulsome endorsement of Vladimir Putin's contested election victory should bar him from council.

title.children: Call for WA councillor to resign over Russia links, Putin endorsement

image.altText: woman looking to her right

props.synopsis: Macalie Adamson spent 18 years using the drug ice, culminating in a near-death experience and homelessness. Now, almost six years into sobriety, she's using her experience to open more conversations about drug use and rehabilitation.

title.children: Easter once came with 'intense fear', but now Macalie is helping others find peace

image.altText: Four wheel drive vehicle travelling through a desert landscape

props.synopsis: With Easter marking the unofficial start of the tourist season, outback authorities are concerned by the number of people getting lost or stuck in Queensland's outback after following location mapping apps.

title.children: Authorities tell tourists 'don't just rely on Google Maps' while travelling through outback Queensland

props.synopsis: Palm Sunday in the Philippines, Chinese rocket launches and a Japanese 'poo' museum — the Asia Pacific this week in pictures.

title.children: In 20 pictures: The Asia Pacific this week

image.altText: Anthony Albanese at a press conference at Parliament House

props.synopsis: Labor didn't pledge to just be better than the alternative, it vowed to set new standards. On that measure, when you consider the secrecy, the attempts to push extraordinary powers through parliament and aversion to public scrutiny, Labor is falling short.

title.children: Albanese vowed his government would be different. This week showed how far it's fallen from that promise

image.altText: Loch Hart festival director Jayden Bath with his partner Tess Birch

props.synopsis: As festivals around Australia struggle to remain viable, one regional event is bucking the trend with a unique early-access subscription model.

title.children: Music festival offers pre-paid subscriptions to fend off Splendour-like cancellation

image.altText: Greg Webb smiles at camera in half-built home

props.synopsis: Bushfire survivors and RFS volunteers have welcomed the state coroner's call to overhaul emergency warning systems, back-burn investigations, and vehicle standards.

title.children: Bushfire survivors back coroner's call to overhaul firefighting systems 'from the ground up'

image.altText: Celeste Manno.

props.synopsis: The mother of murdered woman Celeste Manno says she feels "pure disgust" that Victorian prosecutors would not go to the Court of Appeal and seek a life sentence for the man who took her daughter's life.

title.children: 'Pathetic and weak': Celeste Manno's mum hits out at prosecutors for declining to appeal killer's sentence

image.altText: Vladimir Putin.

props.synopsis: Russian President Vladimir Putin says F-16 fighter jets supplied to Ukraine by Western countries will be shot down, but rules out attacking NATO countries.

title.children: Putin says Russia will 'destroy' F-16 fighter jets supplied to Ukraine, rules out attack on NATO

image.altText: Steve Martin looks slightly to the right as he sits at a table with his arms crossed in front of him, a pensive look on his face

props.synopsis: Morgan Neville's poignant documentary explores the cultural phenomenon that is Steve Martin.

title.children: New doco exploring the life of comedy legend Steve Martin will have you in your feelings

image.altText: A woman on the land

props.synopsis: Scenes of violence and unrest in Alice Springs prompted the NT government to declare a two-week youth curfew in the town on Wednesday. Here's what some community members have to say about the plan.

title.children: The Alice Springs youth curfew has been called a 'circuit breaker', but some say a broader approach is needed

image.altText: An aerial view of Alice Springs, from Anzac Hill.

props.synopsis: People under the age of 18 have been banned from the Alice Springs CBD between 6pm and 6am for the next two weeks, in a dramatic response to unrest in the town. Here's what that means.

title.children: What is a 'safe place'? Here's what we know about the Alice Springs curfew rules

image.altText: Close up photo of Derek Bromley as a middle-aged man, wearing blue cap and blue shirt, smiling.

props.synopsis: A man who spent 40 years in prison for a murder he maintains he did not commit says he feels "overwhelmed" to have been granted parole.

title.children: After 40 years in jail for a murder he says he didn't commit, Derek Bromley is 'overwhelmed' to be granted his freedom

image.altText: A large ship blasts a smaller boat with water in open ocean

props.synopsis: Ferdinand Marcos Junior says his country won't be "cowed into silence" in the face of "dangerous attacks".

title.children: Philippine president tells China he will respond to attacks in the South China Sea

image.altText: A Collingwood player pumps his fist in celebration after a goal.

props.synopsis: Magpies veteran Scott Pendlebury will face scrutiny over a hit on star Lion Lachie Neale, as the Magpies got off the mark against the still winless Lions.

title.children: 'I got sucked in tonight': Pendlebury faces scrutiny for Neale whack as Magpies get off the mark over winless Lions

image.altText: A woman wearing a police hat

props.synopsis: Former Channel Seven producer Steve Jackson will not take up the role of NSW Police media chief with his contract cancelled due to "ongoing media attention".

title.children: NSW Police cancels contract of new media chief two weeks after appointment

image.altText: Composite image featuring Chaka Khan, Carrie Underwood, Joan Jett, Nancy Wilson and more playing instruments and singing..

props.synopsis: From The Triffids to Roberta Flack, to the newest music genre sweeping the world, these documentaries will expand your mind and enrich your soul.

title.children: From Paul McCartney to Aretha Franklin, dive deep into your fave musos with these documentaries
